content: Yes, that's correct. Laser sensors are generally preferred for gaming because they offer higher precision and accuracy. They can also detect movement at higher speeds and on more surfaces, making them a popular choice for gamers who require fast and accurate mouse movements. However, it's important to note that optical sensors can still be adequate for many gamers, and other factors such as DPI and polling rate can also affect overall performance. Ultimately, it comes down to personal preference and the specific needs of the user.
